data.title: Living in Tualatin OR Guide üõù ‚òÄÔ∏è | Is Moving to Tualatin Right for You?
data.meta_description: Tualatin, Oregon is one of the most popular Portland suburbs, and for good reason! üå≥ Here‚Äôs everything you should know about living in Tualatin, Oregon.
data.text:
Last Updated on:

First established in 1869, Tualatin is a city in northwestern Oregon and is a suburb in the Portland Metropolitan Area. First called ‚ÄúGalbreath‚Äù after the city‚Äôs founder Samuel Galbreath, Tualatin has been known as ‚ÄúBridgeport‚Äù and ‚ÄúTualitin‚Äù before the area‚Äôs name was finally changed to ‚ÄúTualatin‚Äù in 1915. Today, Tualatin is known for its prime location, diverse population, and highly-rated schools. As such, Tualatin is a good place to live. Before moving to Tualatin, take a deep dive into everything this lively city has to offer.

Where Is Tualatin Oregon?

Where is Tualatin? Tualatin Oregon is in Washington and Clackamas County, with most of the city located in Washington County. Tualatin is a southwestern suburb of Portland, and it is only 12 miles from Tualatin, OR to Portland, OR, and 30 miles from Tualatin, OR to Salem, OR.

Tualatin is very well known for its proximity to natural attractions and dedication to preserving nature. The Tualatin River flows along the city‚Äôs northern boundary, and Tualatin has been named a Tree City USA by the National Arbor Day Foundation for over 35 years. The City of Tualatin is also just a short distance to skiing, snowboarding, and sledding on Mt. Hood in the Cascade Mountain Range, and swimming, wind-surfing, and parasailing on the central Oregon Coast.

Tualatin Oregon Population & Demographics

The Tualatin OR population is 27,942, which is a 7.2% increase since 2010. Tualatin is also a part of the Portland Metropolitan Area, which has a population of 2.51 million. Tualatin has a fairly diverse population, with a racial and ethnic composition of 72.9% White (66.3% non-Hispanic), 12.5% two or more races, 3.0% Asian, 1.9% Black or African American, 1.8% American Indian, and 1.6% Native Hawaiian.

The citizens living in Tualatin Oregon are very well educated, with 94.2% of residents holding a high school degree. 45.3% of residents hold a bachelor‚Äôs degree (or higher), which is 10% higher than the rate in the Portland Metro Area (41%) and 1.3% the rate in Oregon (35%). This education shows, as the median household income in Tualatin is $97,931, which is higher than the Oregon average of $70,084.

Additional Tualatin Demographics:

Sex ratio: 51% female, 49% male

Median age: 37.5

Foreign-born population: 11.1%

Notable people from Tualatin: basketball player Payton Pritchard, gymnast Jordan Chiles, author Roland Smith

Is Tualatin a safe place to live? The Tualatin crime rate is 2,818 crimes per 100,000 people. This is 4.5% lower than the state average and 20.1% higher than the national average. Most of the crime in Tualatin is property crime, which although frustrating, is not typically a threat to your safety. The property crime rate in Tualatin is 2.6% lower than the state average and 32.3% higher than the national average. The violent crime rate is 21.9% lower than the state average and 41.2% lower than the national average. As such, Tualatin is a safe place to live.

Serving the citizens of Tualatin is the Tualatin Police Department, which has 40 officers on the force.

Tualatin Oregon Cost of Living

How much does it cost to live in Tualatin? The Tualatin Oregon Cost of Living Index is 128.1, making it 28.1% more expensive than the national average of 100. Although it is a bit higher than the national average, it is important to remember that the median household income is much higher than the state and national averages, allowing citizens to live a more affluent lifestyle.

According to the Economic Policy Institute, a family of four living in Tualatin would need to earn $108,846 per year to live in the city.

Typical Tualatin Living Expenses

Average Tualatin utilities per month: $161.97

Monthly cell phone bill: $171.24

Gallon of gas: $4.15

Loaf of bread: $4.19

Carton of eggs: $2.43

Doctor‚Äôs visit: $132.53

Source: PayScale

If you are looking for Tualatin real estate, then you have an abundance of options. The average home price in Tualatin is $630,000, according to Redfin. Although this is higher than the national average of $412,502, the Tualatin, Oregon real estate market is holding steady. Home prices are only up 0.08% from last year, and homes sit on the market for an average of 22 days.

Do you want to rent Tualatin OR real estate? The average rent in Tualatin is $1,828, according to RentCafe. This is a bit higher than both the national average ($1,702) and the Portland average ($1,763).

Tualatin Neighborhoods | Where to Live in Tualatin

These are a few of the best neighborhoods in Tualatin to plant your roots.

Downtown Tualatin | Great for Young Professionals

Downtown Tualatin is a popular neighborhood among young professionals who enjoy apartment-style living. This neighborhood is in the center of all of the action and is within walking distance of many of the city‚Äôs best restaurants. This area is home to Tualatin Commons Park, which has many beautiful condos and apartments with riverfront views.

Atfalati Park | Popular Among Families

The Atfalati Park area is in eastern Tualatin and is one of the best places to live in Tualatin for families. The homes in this area are large and have spacious yards with plenty of space for children to play in. This neighborhood is also within walking distance of both Legacy Meridian Park Medical Center and Bridgeport Elementary School.

West Tualatin | Quiet Area Great for Retirees

If you‚Äôre looking for a laid-back style of living, then head over to West Tualatin. The homes in this area are set back from any major roads, allowing citizens to enjoy peace and quiet all day long. It is also home to Tualatin Island Greens, which is a golf driving range complete with a golf shop and restaurant.

Tualatin OR Weather & Climate

According to the K√∂ppen Classification, Tualatin has a warm summer Mediterranean climate. This means that the weather in Tualatin Oregon is characterized by cool, rainy winters and warm, dry summers.

The average temperature in Tualatin over the summer is around 76¬∫F, while the average temperature over the winter is around 36¬∫F. Because the Tualatin climate does not typically include temperatures below freezing, the Tualatin annual snowfall is only 2 inches.

Things to Do in Tualatin

After moving to Tualatin, you can get your grocery shopping done at Fred Meyer or New Seasons Market ‚Äì Nyberg Rivers. You will also find an abundance of retail shopping at Bridgeport Village and Nyberg Woods Shopping Center. Here are just a few things to do in Tualatin, OR that you can‚Äôt skip out on.

Browns Ferry Park

Browns Ferry Park is one of the best things to do in Tualatin Oregon. This 28-acre natural park is located on the Tualatin River and includes a pathway system, picnic tables, wildlife viewing areas, and kayak and canoe rentals.

5855 SW Nyberg Ln, Tualatin, OR 97062, 503-691-3061

Tualatin Lake at the Commons

This beautiful area is located in Downtown Tualatin and features a lake, an interactive fountain, and restaurants. In the summer, the city puts on a free concert series that takes place overlooking the water.

8325 SW Nyberg St, Tualatin, OR 97062, 503-691-3091

Lee Farms

When looking for fun things to do in Tualatin Oregon, you can‚Äôt skip out on Lee Farms! This family-friendly attraction opens every fall and includes a pumpkin patch, hay rides, corn mazes, and a petting zoo.

21975 SW 65th Ave, Tualatin, OR 97062, 503-638-1869

Additional Attractions in Tualatin

Atfalati Park

Ibach Park

Tualatin Heritage Center

Tualatin Community Park

If you are looking for more fun things to do in Tualatin, you can check out the official city calendar for upcoming events.

Tualatin Restaurants

Don‚Äôt skip out on these amazing restaurants in Tualatin Oregon.

La Industria

This trendy Tex-Mex joint is one of the best Tualatin OR restaurants and features tapas, homemade guacamole, and specialty margaritas.

20185 SW 112th Ave, Tualatin, OR 97062, 503-454-0647

Roxy‚Äôs Island Grill

Stop by Roxy‚Äôs Island Grill and enjoy some traditional Hawaiian BBQ. Make sure you try the Shoyu Chicken, which is their #1 best seller!

8290 SW Nyberg St, Tualatin, OR 97062, 971-444-9835

Mashita Teriyaki

Mashita Teriyaki is one of the most popular restaurants in Tualatin and serves up fresh tasty teriyaki and yakisoba every day of the week.

18810 SW Boones Ferry Rd, Tualatin, OR 97062, 503-885-7661

Jobs in Tualatin

If you are looking for Tualatin jobs, then you are in luck! Many people living in Tualatin commute to Portland for work, although there is still an abundance of jobs in the city to choose from. Many jobs in Tualatin Oregon are in the retail and manufacturing industries. The city is home to many shopping centers such as Bridgeport Village, Nyberg Woods, and Nyberg Rivers. The latter mall contains over 300,000 square feet of retail space, offering thousands of jobs to residents in the area.

A few of the biggest manufacturing companies in Tualatin include:

Lam Research: Makes electrochemical deposition tools

CRKT: Knife manufacturer

KAI USA: Knife manufacturer

Oregon Scientific: Manufacturer of consumer electronics products, headquartered in Tualatin

According to PayScale, the average salary in Tualatin is $80,000 per year. If you are on the hunt for jobs in Tualatin, then try checking out Indeed or searching the city job board.

Tualatin Oregon Schools

The City of Tualatin is served by the Tigard-Tualatin School District. This Tualatin school district contains 10 elementary schools, three middle schools, and two high schools. In May of 2023, the Tigard-Tualatin School District opened its newest school, Rutkin Elementary, which was a result of a $292 million bond project passed by voters in 2016.

Hazelbrook Middle School is also home to the Portland Japanese School, which is a Japanese weekend supplementary school for Japanese citizens and Japanese Americans. Each summer, PJS sends a few school employees to Japan to study Japanese culture.

Tualatin is also home to the Horizon Christian School, which is a private Christian college preparatory school for grades Pre-K-12. This private school in Tualatin currently serves 700 students across two different campuses, and over 90% of its graduates go on to attend college.

When living in Tualatin, students and residents can enjoy access to the Tualatin Public Library.

Tualatin Statistics & Information

County: Washington & Clackamas

Tualatin area: 8.40 square miles

Tualatin zip code: 97062

Tualatin area code: 503, 971

Tualatin elevation: 123 feet

Tualatin time zone: Pacific Standard Time (UTC-8)

Closest airport to Tualatin: Portland International Airport (PDX), 22.7 miles
